channel.title: attack.command_and_control on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in attack.command_and_control on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Wannacry Killswitch Domain
item.description: Detects wannacry killswitch domain dns queries

item.title: DNSCat2 Powershell Implementation Detection Via Process Creation
item.description: The PowerShell implementation of DNSCat2 calls nslookup to craft queries. Counting nslookup processes spawned by PowerShell will show hundreds or thousands of instances if PS DNSCat2 is active locally.

item.title: Empire UserAgent URI Combo
item.description: Detects user agent and URI paths used by empire agents

item.title: Potential Remote Desktop Connection to Non-Domain Host
item.description: Detects logons using NTLM to hosts that are potentially not part of the domain.

item.title: Notepad Making Network Connection
item.description: Detects suspicious network connection by Notepad

item.title: PwnDrp Access
item.description: Detects downloads from PwnDrp web servers developed for red team testing and most likely also used for criminal activity

item.title: Suspicious ADSI-Cache Usage By Unknown Tool
item.description: Detects the usage of ADSI (LDAP) operations by tools. This may also detect tools like LDAPFragger.

item.title: Suspicious LDAP-Attributes Used
item.description: Detects the usage of particular AttributeLDAPDisplayNames, which are known for data exchange via LDAP by the tool LDAPFragger and are additionally not commonly used in companies.

item.title: PowerShell DownloadFile
item.description: Detects the execution of powershell, a WebClient object creation and the invocation of DownloadFile in a single command line

item.title: Curl Start Combination
item.description: Adversaries can use curl to download payloads remotely and execute them. Curl is included by default in Windows 10 build 17063 and later.

item.title: Copy from Admin Share
item.description: Detects a suspicious copy command from a remote C$ or ADMIN$ share

item.title: Silence.EDA Detection
item.description: Detects Silence empireDNSagent

item.title: Cisco Stage Data
item.description: Various protocols maybe used to put data on the device for exfil or infil

item.title: Malicious Payload Download via Office Binaries
item.description: Downloads payload from remote server

item.title: Exfiltration and Tunneling Tools Execution
item.description: Execution of well known tools for data exfiltration and tunneling

item.title: High DNS Requests Rate
item.description: High DNS requests amount from host per short period of time

item.title: High NULL Records Requests Rate
item.description: Extremely high rate of NULL record type DNS requests from host per short period of time. Possible result of iodine tool execution

item.title: High TXT Records Requests Rate
item.description: Extremely high rate of TXT record type DNS requests from host per short period of time. Possible result of Do-exfiltration tool execution

item.title: SILENTTRINITY Stager Execution
item.description: Detects SILENTTRINITY stager use

item.title: Crypto Miner User Agent
item.description: Detects suspicious user agent strings used by crypto miners in proxy logs

item.title: Possible DNS Tunneling
item.description: Normally, DNS logs contain a limited amount of different dns queries for a single domain. This rule detects a high amount of queries for a single domain, which can be an indicator that DNS is used to transfer data.

item.title: RDP Over Reverse SSH Tunnel
item.description: Detects svchost hosting RDP termsvcs communicating with the loopback address and on TCP port 3389

item.title: RDP over Reverse SSH Tunnel WFP
item.description: Detects svchost hosting RDP termsvcs communicating with the loopback address

item.title: Chafer Malware URL Pattern
item.description: Detects HTTP requests used by Chafer malware

item.title: Command Line Execution with Suspicious URL and AppData Strings
item.description: Detects a suspicious command line execution that includes an URL and AppData string in the command line parameters as used by several droppers (js/vbs > powershell)

item.title: MsiExec Web Install
item.description: Detects suspicious msiexec process starts with web addreses as parameter

item.title: Suspicious Certutil Command
item.description: Detects a suspicious Microsoft certutil execution with sub commands like ‘decode’ sub command, which is sometimes used to decode malicious code with the built-in certutil utility

item.title: Suspicious TSCON Start
item.description: Detects a tscon.exe start as LOCAL SYSTEM

item.title: CobaltStrike Malleable (OCSP) Profile
item.description: Detects Malleable (OCSP) Profile with Typo (OSCP) in URL

item.title: CobaltStrike Malleable OneDrive Browsing Traffic Profile
item.description: Detects Malleable OneDrive Profile

item.title: Suspicious DNS Query with B64 Encoded String
item.description: Detects suspicious DNS queries using base64 encoding

item.title: Cobalt Strike DNS Beaconing
item.description: Detects suspicious DNS queries known from Cobalt Strike beacons

item.title: Chafer Activity
item.description: Detects Chafer activity attributed to OilRig as reported in Nyotron report in March 2018

item.title: Equation Group C2 Communication
item.description: Detects communication to C2 servers mentioned in the operational notes of the ShadowBroker leak of EquationGroup C2 tools

item.title: Suspicious Typical Malware Back Connect Ports
item.description: Detects programs that connect to typical malware back connect ports based on statistical analysis from two different sandbox system databases

item.title: Windows PowerShell User Agent
item.description: Detects Windows PowerShell Web Access

item.title: Windows WebDAV User Agent
item.description: Detects WebDav DownloadCradle

item.title: Antivirus Exploitation Framework Detection
item.description: Detects a highly relevant Antivirus alert that reports an exploitation framework

item.title: APT User Agent
item.description: Detects suspicious user agent strings used in APT malware in proxy logs

item.title: APT40 Dropbox Tool User Agent
item.description: Detects suspicious user agent string of APT40 Dropbox tool

item.title: Bitsadmin to Uncommon TLD
item.description: Detects Bitsadmin connections to domains with uncommon TLDs - https://twitter.com/jhencinski/status/1102695118455349248 - https://isc.sans.edu/forums/diary/Investigating+Microsoft+BITS+Activity/23281/

item.title: CobaltStrike Malleable Amazon Browsing Traffic Profile
item.description: Detects Malleable Amazon Profile

item.title: DNS Tunnel Technique from MuddyWater
item.description: Detecting DNS tunnel activity for Muddywater actor

item.title: DNS TXT Answer with Possible Execution Strings
item.description: Detects strings used in command execution in DNS TXT Answer

item.title: Download from Suspicious Dyndns Hosts
item.description: Detects download of certain file types from hosts with dynamic DNS names (selected list)

item.title: Empty User Agent
item.description: Detects suspicious empty user agent strings in proxy logs

item.title: Exploit Framework User Agent
item.description: Detects suspicious user agent strings used by exploit / pentest framworks like Metasploit in proxy logs

item.title: GALLIUM Artefacts
item.description: Detects artefacts associated with activity group GALLIUM - Microsoft Threat Intelligence Center indicators released in December 2019.

item.title: Greenbug Campaign Indicators
item.description: Detects tools and process executions as observed in a Greenbug campaign in May 2020

item.title: Malware User Agent
item.description: Detects suspicious user agent strings used by malware in proxy logs

item.title: Netsh Port Forwarding
item.description: Detects netsh commands that configure a port forwarding

item.title: Netsh RDP Port Forwarding
item.description: Detects netsh commands that configure a port forwarding of port 3389 used for RDP

item.title: Raw Paste Service Access
item.description: Detects direct access to raw pastes in different paste services often used by malware in their second stages to download malicious code in encrypted or encoded form

item.title: Suspicious C2 Activities
item.description: Detects suspicious activities as declared by Florian Roth in its ‘Best Practice Auditd Configuration’. This includes the detection of the following commands; wget, curl, base64, nc, netcat, ncat, ssh, socat, wireshark, rawshark, rdesktop, nmap. These commands match a few techniques from the tactics “Command and Control”, including not exhaustively the following; Application Layer Protocol (T1071), Non-Application Layer Protocol (T1095), Data Encoding (T1132)

item.title: Suspicious Curl Usage on Windows
item.description: Detects a suspicious curl process start on Windows and outputs the requested document to a local file

item.title: Suspicious Desktopimgdownldr Command
item.description: Detects a suspicious Microsoft desktopimgdownldr execution with parameters used to download files from the Internet

item.title: Telegram API Access
item.description: Detects suspicious requests to Telegram API without the usual Telegram User-Agent

item.title: Telegram Bot API Request
item.description: Detects suspicious DNS queries to api.telegram.org used by Telegram Bots of any kind

item.title: Turla ComRAT
item.description: Detects Turla ComRAT patterns
